paper_abstract: We analyze univariate oscillatory integrals for the standard Sobolev spaces H-s of periodic and non-periodic functions with an arbitrary integer s >= 1. We find matching lower and upper bounds on the minimal worst case error of algorithms that use n function or derivative values. We also find sharp bounds on the information complexity which is the minimal n for which the absolute or normalized error is at most epsilon. We show surprising relations between the information complexity and the oscillatory weight. We also briefly consider the case of s = infinity. (C) 2014 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Complexity of oscillatory integration for univariate Sobolev spaces
